==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ぐ|たい|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Originally from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=くたい'}} {{m|zh|具體|tr=gju<sup>H</sup> thej<sup>X</sup>|lit=arrange + body}}, used in {{w|Mencius}}'s writings with a meaning close to the literal sense, ''the entirety is arranged, in order''.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

Repurposed in the 1881 work {{lang|ja|哲学字彙}} (''Tetsugaku Jii'', “Dictionary of Philosophy”) by {{w|Inoue Tetsujirō}} as a translation of the {{etyl|en|-}} term {{m|en|concrete}}, as opposed to {{m|en|abstract}}.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|ぐたい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}
